elements.text:
Answer: "Authentication flows through AuthMiddleware →
AuthService → TokenValidator. The middleware intercepts..."

Most of the context window is consumed by exploration,
leaving limited space for actual reasoning and code generation.
• File reads consume tokens (500 lines ≈ 2,000 tokens)
AI Assistant asks: "How does authentication work?"

Grounded Answer
+ Source Codes
+ Call Chains
+ Documentation
Find source files • Compute SHA-256 hashes • Only changed files reprocessed
Tree-sitter AST • Extract classes, functions, imports • Type inference • Call resolution
Create nodes (Project, File, Class, Function) • Create edges (CALLS, EXTENDS, IMPORTS)
LLM generates descriptions • Purpose, parameters, usage patterns

• Analyze query intent
• Extract target entities
• Determine graph/vector weighting

1. Locate target entities
2. Traverse CALLS relationships
3. Gather callers, callees

1. Embed the query
2. Search Qdrant for similar
3. Return top-K with scores

Merge results • Score • Deduplicate
10% boost for results in both searches
LLM synthesizes answer with source citations

✓ Complete call chain
with depth tracking

Split by heading hierarchy

# Auth Guide → Chunk 1
## OAuth Flow → Chunk 2
## JWT Tokens → Chunk 3

Link docs to code:

• Explicit: `AuthService`
• Implicit: semantic match
• Confidence scores
Major drift = docs don't match implementation

Agent implements new payment
following legacy patterns

❌ Result: Code doesn't follow
current architecture

✓ Result: Agent follows current
patterns, integrates correctly

Graph Signals:
• Relationship weight
• Distance decay
• Centrality

Vector Signals:
• Cosine similarity
• Code quality
• Entity type boost

2. OrderHandler.submit     (0.87) ← Hybrid boost!
3. PaymentProcessor.run    (0.82)
4. CheckoutFlow.process    (0.78)
